intro: Convallaria majalis f. picta, commonly known as the spotted lily or variegated lily, is a striking variant of the traditional lily. This plant features distinctive white and green variegation on its leaves, which adds visual interest to gardens. It is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia, typically growing in woodland or shaded areas. The flowers are usually white or pink, with a bell-shaped form, and they bloom in early spring. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking unique foliage in shaded landscapes.
